article: Troubleshooting a Vizio TV That Wonâ€™t Connect to WiFi
intro: If your Vizio TV won't connect to Wi-Fi whether

steps.title: SmartCast will not work properly if your internet connection is weak.MenuNetworkTest Connection
steps.subtitle: Go to  >  >  to see your network connection status. If your connection speed is 0 or unavailable, you need to fix your TV and internet connection by doing things like , , and other  (most of which are covered in following sections in this article).
sub-points: You will not see a wireless connection if your TV is connected with an ethernet cable.
If you're trying to use hotel or hospital Wi-Fi, talk with the IT there to get steady access without needing to log in with a web page.
Mobile hotspots don't have reliable internet connections.

points.name: Connect to a Wi-Fi access point.

steps.title: You may just need to reconnect.Menu > Network
steps.subtitle: Go to  and select a Wi-Fi network. Use your Wi-Fi network's password to connect.
sub-points: You can't plug an ethernet cable into your Vizio TV and connect to Wi-Fi simultaneously.

steps.title: An incorrect password can prevent you from connecting to your Wi-Fi.
steps.subtitle: Remember, passwords are caps sensitive! An uppercase "O" might look like a "0", so take your time and type your network password into your TV as accurately as you can.
sub-points: Find your current connection status in  > .
If you haven't changed the Wi-Fi password, you'll find the default one on a sticker on your router.
if you forgot it.

steps.title: Your current session can have glitches that cause your TV not to work with Wi-Fi.
steps.subtitle: Power cycling is more thorough than simply turning it off and back on again. Here's what you need to do to power cycle your TV:
sub-points: Unplug your TV from the wall socket.
While the TV is unplugged, press and hold the Power button on your TV for 15-30 seconds.
Plug the TV back into power and turn it back on to see if you solved the issue.

steps.subtitle: Power cycling is more thorough than simply turning it off and back on again. Here's what you need to do to power cycle your TV:

points.name: See if anything else connects to your Wi-Fi.

steps.title: Your router or the hardware in your TV can be why it's not connecting to Wi-Fi.
steps.subtitle: See if your phone will connect to your router, but if it does, you can safely assume that something is wrong with your TV. You may need to unblock the TV from your router, even if you never blocked it in the first place. You can unblock from the router's website or your ISP's mobile app.
sub-points: If your TV is the only device having problems connecting to Wi-Fi (and it hasn't been blocked), you may need a repair.
If other devices cannot connect to your router, your router needs more troubleshooting.

steps.title: Your router or the hardware in your TV can be why it's not connecting to Wi-Fi.
steps.subtitle: See if your phone will connect to your router, but if it does, you can safely assume that something is wrong with your TV. You may need to unblock the TV from your router, even if you never blocked it in the first place. You can unblock from the router's website or your ISP's mobile app.
sub-points: If your TV is the only device having problems connecting to Wi-Fi (and it hasn't been blocked), you may need a repair.
If other devices cannot connect to your router, your router needs more troubleshooting.

steps.title: It can have a glitch that is preventing your TV from working properly with the internet.
steps.subtitle: To , follow these steps:
sub-points: Unplug your router from power.
Wait for about 2 minutes.
Plug your router back into power.

steps.title: Reset to your settings to get rid of anything that can be causing SmartCast not to work.Menu/Admin & Privacy > Reset to Factory Settings > OK.
steps.subtitle: To reset your TV, go to
sub-points: Note that this erases any personal settings that you've created, like color profiles and configurations.
